Fales Library and Special Collections
Judith Braun Papers
Braun, Judith
MSS.530
6.5 Linear Feet in 4 record cartons, 1 manuscript box, and 2 oversize flat boxes.
1978-2014 Materials in English. The Judith Braun Papers consist of records of artist Judith Braun's creative feminist work from 1987 to 2014. Artwork, research, correspondence, and articles pertaining to her exhibitions from 1978 to 1997 create the bulk of this collection. After graduating from Empire State College in Saratoga Springs, New York in 1979 with a Bachelor's Degree in Fine Arts, Braun pursued realistic figure painting until 1982 when she transitioned to combining her visual artwork with text and innuendo through photocopying. The artwork within this collection reflects Braun's changing artistic output and her creation of the persona Weinperson. Applications for grants, residencies, and show proposals from 1987 to 2011 are included as a part of this collection as well as a small amount of interviews from 2012 to 2014. The posters available in this collection are remnants of Braun's large scale photocopying process. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The Judith Braun Papers consist of records of artist Judith Braun's creative work from 1987 to 2014. Artwork, research, correspondence, and articles pertaining to exhibitions of her work from 1978 to 1997 create the bulk of this collection. The collection also contains applications for grants, residencies, and show proposals from 1987 to 2011, as well as interviews with Braun from 2012 to 2014. Of particular significance to the trajectory of Braun's artistic career are the collection of tarot card readings from 1998 to 2001, which inspired her to re-enter the art world in 2001. The collection documents Braun's large scale photocopying process with initial images, enlarged photocopied grid pieces, photographs and slides of large scale wall hangings, and large scale posters.
Biographical Note
Judith Braun (1947 - ), also known as Judith Weinperson and Weinperson, is a New York City-based artist. After graduating from Empire State College in Saratoga Springs, New York, in 1979 with a Bachelor's Degree in Fine Arts, she pursued realistic figure painting until 1982 when she transitioned to combining her visual artwork with text and innuendo through photocopying. During this artistic transition Braun was pursuing her Masters in Fine Arts at the University of Albany in Albany, New York, graduating in 1983. In 1989 she created the persona Weinperson, an alteration of her married name Weinman. The Weinperson persona represented Braun in her experiments with racial and sexual innuendos in her photocopied creations. Braun exhibited as Weinperson or Judith Weinperson from 1988 to 1995 before retreating from her creative practice until 2003.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Judith Braun was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Judith Braun Papers; MSS 530; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, the collection was arranged into series based on the original order and topical arrangement of the records created and maintained by Judith Braun, and original folder titles were retained.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor Judith Braun. The donor arrangement has ten series without subseries. These series were labeled by the artist to aid her artistic process. The series arrangement is:
Series I. Proposals - Correspondence - Shows
Series II. Articles - Reading
Series III. Applications
Series IV. Artwork
Series V. Early Brochures
Series VI. Notebooks
Series VII. Newspaper Clippings
Series VIII. Weinperson
Series IX. Tarot
Series X. Posters
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Judith Braun, 2017. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.029.

Series I. Proposals - Correspondence - Shows1987-2014
Scope and Contents
The Proposals - Correspondence - Shows series contains correspondence between Braun and organizations interested in her artwork and dates between 1987 to 2014. Scope and Contents
The Artwork series is a record of Braun's creative process producing her 152 week serial art piece ANNOUNCEMENT and her colossal photocopied wall art. Scope and Contents
The Early Brochures series consists of pamphlets from Braun's exhibitions from 1980 to 1992 in both solo and group shows.Early Brochures1980-1994345 - 51Series VI. Notebooks1978-1994
Scope and Contents
The Notebooks series contains notebooks describing Braun's compositions from 1978 to 1994. Included in this series are clippings collected by Braun to influence her artwork on racial and sexual innuendo as well as slides of her work from 1978 to 1994. Braun's handwritten notebooks contain few sketches and are filled with lists and art production goals. These notebooks document the art creation of a year or are dedicated to a specific art piece.6 November 1993 - 12 December 19941993-19943529 December 1992- 5 November 19931992-1993353Berlin - Show 1992 Preshow Notes19923542 April 1991 - 7 August 1991199135530 July 1990 - 2 April 1991,1990-199235631 March 1989 - 25 July 19901989-1990413 June 1988 - 31 March 19891988-1989424 August 1987 - 30 May 19881987-1988436 May 1987 - 30 July 19871987446 January 1986 - 6 May 19871986-198745Painting 6 January 1985 - 17 December 19851985461979 - 80 - SUNYA197947The State Wall 1979197948Pierce Hall Mural 1978197849Empire State College 1ST Contract - Bill Frankonis ReadingsUndated410Announcement Cards 1980's - 90's1982-1994411Series VII. Weinperson1993-2001
Scope and Contents
The Weinperson series consists of a numerical series of photocopied postcards and production material for the art piece ANNOUNCEMENT. This material dates from 1993 to 2001 and was created by Braun using her Weinperson persona exploring her visual interpretations of racial and sexual innuendo. The finished product of 152 post cards are arranged together at the beginning of the series and then the preparation for each week's art piece is collected in numbered folders.Weinperson ANNOUNCEMENT1993-1994423YES, I HAVE NO RESERVATIONS2001424ANNOUNCEMENTS Mailing List/Stamps1993425ANNOUNCEMENTS - "MIDDLE-AGE-SEX-MANIAC" #11993426#2 ANNOUNCEMENTS - "MORE FUCKING TIME"1993427ANNOUNCEMENTS - "TOO" #31993428ANNOUNCEMENTS - "GOOD SECRET" #41993429ANNOUNCEMENTS - "BORN-ON-A-BACK-SEAT" #51993430ANNOUNCEMENTS "I WANT TO DANCE W/YOU" #61993431ANNOUNCEMENTS "AND SHOUT NOW" #71993432"MORALITY FROM DEVIANCE" 81993433"LOUDER NOW" #91993434"NICE & DIRTY #101993435"WEINPERSONALLY YOURS" #111993436"JUST FUCKING WITH YOU" #121993437"I'M NOT JUST FUCKING W/YOU" #131993438"YOU CAN CALL ME WEINBABE" #141993439"... Tarot1998-2001
Scope and Contents
The Tarot series consists of tarot card readings and information on tarot interpretation, dating from 1998 to 2001.Tarot School1998528Daily Reads1998529Theory TarotUndated530Tarot Tarot - Me 19981998531Tarot - Me 19981998532Tarot - Me 1999 - 20011999-2001533Series X. Posters1990-1995
Scope and Contents
The Posters series contains gridwork that was integral to Braun's colossal wall art photocopying process. This art process material is from her exhibitions in between 1990 and 1995. This collection contains gridwork posters from her exhibitions at Sonyun Yi Gallery in New York from 1990; the University of Alabama in Tuscaloosa, Alabama from 1991; On The Wall Gallery in New York from 1990; Columbia University in New York from 1991; the Drawing Center in New York from 1990; the Künstlerhaus Bethanien in Berlin, Germany from 1992; and the New Museum for Contemporary Art in New York in 1994.READ MY PUSSY199061-2READ MY PUSSY - Village Voice199063WEINPERSONUndated64SACRED ORDER OF THE BURNING BUSHUndated654.95199566GOOD IN BEDUndated67SIX GOOD REASONS FOR MANSLAUGHTERUndated68HAPPY BITCH SERIESUndated69I THINK I LOVE YOUUndated610THE BAOBAB TREEUndated611JUST EAT ITUndated612READ MY PUSSY199071Bad Girls Show199472SACRED ORDER OF THE BURNING BUSH199373
